intro: Eremostachys calophyta, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Eremostachys calophyta is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
